step_data.thought:
I've successfully navigated through the Content section and have now reached the Design Configuration page. This is evident from the URL and the heading 'Design Configuration' visible in the accessibility tree. This page allows me to manage design elements as mentioned in the goal.

Looking at the current page, I can see a table showing different store views and their associated themes. Each row has an 'Edit' link that would allow me to edit the design configuration for that specific store view or website.

The goal was to navigate to the Content section to manage pages, blocks, and design elements. I've successfully completed this task by:
1. Navigating to Pages (previously)
2. Navigating to Blocks (previously)
3. Navigating to Design Configuration (current page)

I've now fully achieved the goal of navigating to the Content section to manage pages, blocks, and design elements. I should inform the user that the task has been completed successfully.
step_data.action: stop('I have successfully navigated to the Content section and accessed the key management areas. I first visited Pages and Blocks under the Elements category, and now I am at the Design Configuration page where you can manage design elements. From here, you can edit design configurations for different store views by using the Edit links in the table.')
